title: Greek-Style Garlic Chicken Breasts Recipe
description: Make Greek-style chicken with this family-favorite recipe! An easy lemon and garlic marinade adds nice flavor to the juicy, grilled chicken breasts.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European Greek Greek-Style Garlic Chicken Breasts 4.5 (333) 241 Reviews 25 Photos This recipe for Greek-style chicken was passed down through my family for years. If you're looking for great-tasting, tender chicken breasts, you'll want to try this! Submitted by Michael Updated on January 20, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 25 25 25 25 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 8 hrs Total Time: 8 hrs 20 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves 1 cup extra virgin olive oil 1 medium lemon, juiced 2 teaspoons crushed garlic 1 ½ teaspoons black pepper 1 teaspoon salt ⅓ teaspoon paprika Directions Cut three slits in each chicken breast to allow marinade to penetrate. Place chicken into a large bowl. Whisk oil, lemon juice, garlic, pepper, salt, and paprika together for about 30 seconds. Pour over chicken; use your hands to work marinade into chicken. Cover and refrigerate, 8 hours to overnight. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate. Cook chicken on the preheated grill until meat is no longer pink and juices run clear, 10 to 12 minutes, flipping halfway through. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). I Made It Print 565 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 644 Calories 58g Fat 4g Carbs 28g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 644 % Daily Value * Total Fat 58g 74% Saturated Fat 8g 42% Cholesterol 68mg 23% Sodium 660mg 29% Total Carbohydrate 4g 1% Dietary Fiber 2g 6% Protein 28g 56% Vitamin C 23mg 25% Calcium 36mg 3% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 360mg 8% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Add Your Photo Photos of Greek-Style Garlic Chicken Breasts 01 of 25 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 25 Photo by  AngelBH70 02/10/2021 03 of 25 Photo by  AngelBH70 02/10/2021 04 of 25 Photo by  DLS 05/22/2020 Delicious! I did add thyme and oregano while the chicken was cooking, but I did not add it to the marinade. I took the tip from another person that commented earlier. My family loved it. I will definitely make this again. As the side dishes I cooked white rice and made a Greek green bean salad which I copied from this site. I love this site!!!! 05 of 25 Photo by  atbarber 07/08/2019 I've been using this marinade for quite sometime for boneless chicken breasts. I add a couple of dashes of cayenne pepper and dried oregano for a little extra flavor. I have found that I can cut WAY down on the amount of olive oil and adjust the lemon juice based on the amount of olive oil used. I also don't feel that the chicken needs to marinate over night. I generally give it anywhere from 30 mins to a couple of hours depending on the day and how much time I have. The result is always a very flavorful, moist chicken! If there are any leftovers, its great cut up and added to a nice green, greek salad! 06 of 25 Photo by  Naresh'n 02/22/2018 07 of 25 Photo by  Ashley Freeman 07/03/2017 08 of 25 Photo by  Tati 06/13/2017 09 of 25 Photo by  Mark 12/25/2016 10 of 25 Photo by  Mark 12/25/2016 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Chili-Lime Chicken Kabobs 1,008 Ratings Rosemary Lemon Grilled Chicken 283 Ratings Jamaican Jerked Chicken 86 Ratings Spicy Chicken Breasts 704 Ratings Garlic Herbed Chicken 19 Ratings Orange Soya Sauce Marinated Chicken 44 Ratings Juicy Chicken Breast Marinade 8 Ratings Grilled Lemon-Pepper Zucchini 52 Ratings Grilled Spatchcocked Greek Chicken 5 Ratings Vietnamese Lemongrass Chicken 82 Ratings Grilled Honey-Lemon Chicken 179 Ratings Chicken Paillard 41 Ratings Cajun Chicken 484 Ratings Jujeh Kabob (Persian Chicken Kabobs) 11 Ratings Spicy Grilled Chicken 231 Ratings Beer Lime Grilled Chicken 489 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Michael
instructions: Cut three slits in each chicken breast to allow marinade to penetrate. Place chicken into a large bowl.;Whisk oil, lemon juice, garlic, pepper, salt, and paprika together for about 30 seconds. Pour over chicken; use your hands to work marinade into chicken. Cover and refrigerate, 8 hours to overnight.;Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.;Cook chicken on the preheated grill until meat is no longer pink and juices run clear, 10 to 12 minutes, flipping halfway through. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
